mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Monroe Hall was built primarily as a social science building; it now houses Arts and Sciences offices and classrooms. Originally housed the economics and commerce programs; home of the graduate business school, 1955-1975. Commerce School 1975-2008. -- Wilson/Neuman/Butler, The University of Virginia Campus Guide, 2nd. ed, 2012. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: James Murray Howard University of Virginia Historic Buildings and Grounds Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
